016
017package org.parboiled.errors;
018
019import org.parboiled.common.Formatter;
020import org.parboiled.common.StringUtils;
021import org.parboiled.matchers.AnyOfMatcher;
022import org.parboiled.matchers.Matcher;
023import org.parboiled.support.Chars;
024import org.parboiled.support.MatcherPath;
025
026import java.util.ArrayList;
027import java.util.List;
028
029/**
030 * A {@link Formatter} for {@link InvalidInputError}s that automatically creates the correct "expected" text
031 * for the error.
032 */
033public class DefaultInvalidInputErrorFormatter implements Formatter<InvalidInputError> {
034
035    public String format(InvalidInputError error) {
036        if (error == null) return "";
037
038        int len = error.getEndIndex() - error.getStartIndex();
039        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
040        if (len > 0) {
041            char c = error.getInputBuffer().charAt(error.getStartIndex());
042            if (c == Chars.EOI) {
043                sb.append("Unexpected end of input");
044            } else {
045                sb.append("Invalid input '")
046                        .append(StringUtils.escape(String.valueOf(c)));
047                if (len > 1) sb.append("...");
048                sb.append('\'');
049            }
050        } else {
051            sb.append("Invalid input");
052        }
053        String expectedString = getExpectedString(error);
054        if (StringUtils.isNotEmpty(expectedString)) {
055            sb.append(", expected ").append(expectedString);
056        }
057        return sb.toString();
058    }
059
060    public String getExpectedString(InvalidInputError error) {
061        // In non recovery-mode there is no complexity in the error and start indices since they are all stable.
062        // However, in recovery-mode the RecoveringParseRunner inserts characters into the InputBuffer, which requires
063        // for all indices taken before to be shifted. The RecoveringParseRunner does this by changing the indexDelta
064        // of the parse runner. All users of the ParseError will then automatically see shifted start and end indices
065        // matching the state of the underlying InputBuffer. However, since the failed MatcherPaths still carry the
066        // "original" indices we need to unapply the IndexDelta in order to be able to compare with them.
067        int pathStartIndex = error.getStartIndex() - error.getIndexDelta();
068
069        List<String> labelList = new ArrayList<String>();
070        for (MatcherPath path : error.getFailedMatchers()) {
071            Matcher labelMatcher = ErrorUtils.findProperLabelMatcher(path, pathStartIndex);
072            if (labelMatcher == null) continue;
073            String[] labels = getLabels(labelMatcher);
074            for (String label : labels) {
075                if (label != null && !labelList.contains(label)) {
076                    labelList.add(label);
077                }
078            }
079        }
080        return join(labelList);
081    }
082
083    /**
084     * Gets the labels corresponding to the given matcher, AnyOfMatchers are treated specially in that their
085     * label is constructed as a list of their contents
086     *
087     * @param matcher the matcher
088     * @return the labels
089     */
090    public String[] getLabels(Matcher matcher) {
091        if ((matcher instanceof AnyOfMatcher) && ((AnyOfMatcher)matcher).characters.toString().equals(matcher.getLabel())) {
092            AnyOfMatcher cMatcher = (AnyOfMatcher) matcher;
093            if (!cMatcher.characters.isSubtractive()) {
094                String[] labels = new String[cMatcher.characters.getChars().length];
095                for (int i = 0; i < labels.length; i++) {
096                    labels[i] = '\'' + String.valueOf(cMatcher.characters.getChars()[i]) + '\'';
097                }
098                return labels;
099            }
100        }
101        return new String[] {matcher.getLabel()};
102    }
103
104    public String join(List<String> labelList) {
105        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
106        for (int i = 0; i < labelList.size(); i++) {
107            if (i > 0) sb.append(i < labelList.size() - 1 ? ", " : " or ");
108            sb.append(labelList.get(i));
109        }
110        return StringUtils.escape(sb.toString());
111    }
112
113}
